customer_addr:
317 W. PROSPECT RD.
FORT COLLINS, CO 80526

citations.narrative:
During the inspection, the female bobcat “Maggie” escaped from her enclosure. The employee that cleaned the outdoor
enclosure did not close the secondary containment doors that connected to her transfer area before shifting her outside.
This allowed the bobcat to be outside her enclosure but inside the perimeter fence. The facility was able to return the
bobcat to her enclosure within 20 minutes.
Improper handling of animals during cleaning and shifting can result in escape and/or injury. Handling of all animals shall
be done as expeditiously and carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause trauma, overheating, excessive
cooling, behavioral stress, physical harm, or unnecessary discomfort.
To be corrected by June 3rd, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.38(f)(1) 
   
Miscellaneous. 
During the inspection, the female bobcat “Maggie” escaped from her enclosure. The employee that cleaned the outdoor 
enclosure did not close the secondary containment doors that connected to her transfer area before shifting her outside. 
This allowed the bobcat to be outside her enclosure but inside the perimeter fence. The facility was able to return the 
bobcat to her enclosure within 20 minutes. 
Improper handling of animals during cleaning and shifting can result in escape and/or injury. Handling of all animals shall 
be done as expeditiously and carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause trauma, overheating, excessive 
cooling, behavioral stress, physical harm, or unnecessary discomfort.  
To be corrected by June 3rd, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
